results.title: Handling the catch
results.creator_credit: Dennis Shand, Central Office of Information and Film Workshop
results.brief_description: For five days and nights a trawler steams up the east coast of Britain to reach the northern fishing grounds of the Atlantic. The object of this routine voyage is to spend two weeks catching, preserving and landing some twelve thousand pounds worth of high quality white fish. The importance of cleanliness, care and cooling is stressed in order to preserve a profitable catch.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Shand, Central Office of Information and Film Workshop

results.title: Handling dangerous chemicals: bases
results.brief_description: Explains the characteristics of bases, the solubility of sodium hydroxide pellets in the air, proper techniques for dissolving solid bases in water and stoppering reagent bottles.

results.title: Handling dangerous chemicals: acids
results.brief_description: Shows the viscosity of concentrated acids, effects of nitric hydrochloric and sulphuric acids on skin and on clothing. Demonstrates the proper techniques for diluting concentrated acids and the use of emergency fountains to flush acids from the face and eyes.
results.description: Shows the viscosity of concentrated acids, effects of nitric hydrochloric and sulphuric acids on skin and on clothing. Demonstrates the proper techniques for diluting concentrated acids and the use of emergency fountains to flush acids from the face and eyes.

results.title: Handle with care
results.brief_description: Shows the various processes involved in the production of a modern long-playing record from the recording session to the final disc. The importance of quality control is emphasised at each stage of the process. Includes cutting the acetate disc from the tape, processing of the acetate disc to give the final stamper, and the stamping of records from a mixture of polymer, stabilizer and carbon black.

results.title: Handle with care: packaging
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Hughes and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: The object of this film is to show the stresses and strains packages have to withstand and point out the need for care and attention when handling them. An actual packing case is followed from despatch to consignee, involving transport by sea and road and exposure to weather. Emphasises that the actual expense incurred in repairing damaged packages, although amounting to many thousands of pounds, is trifling compared to the loss of the customer’s goodwill.

results.title: Handle with care: glass
results.creator_credit: Mohan Wadhwani, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A brief history of the Indian glass industry, contrasting the products of the individual artisan and the modern streamlined factory. To aid the industry, the Government established the Central Glass and ceramic Research Institute in Calcutta to conduct research into new types of glass.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mohan Wadhwani, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Handicrafts of India (Travancore)
results.creator_credit: A. Bhaskar Rao, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Leaves of tress, buffalo horns and multi-colored sand and shells from the beach at Cape Comorin are some of the simple materials which the gifted craftsmen of Travancore deftly turn into beautiful and fascinating handicrafts. The film also shows lace manufacture depicting the work of the men, women and children of Travancore.
results.creator_credit_for_label: A. Bhaskar Rao, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Handicrafts of Japan
results.creator_credit: Dentsu and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: A survey of the traditional handicrafts of Japan. Crafts shown in some detail are the hand painting of costumes and features; spinning and dyeing of thread for home weaving; the making of bamboo baskets, paper lanterns and decorated paper fans. Examples of clay pottery of all shapes, sizes and design with intricate and skilful glazing and decoration is also presented.

results.title: A Handful of soil
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Mollot and Sam Orleans and Associates
results.brief_description: Research in the development of antibiotics, particularly that of Dr Selman Waksman; also cooperation of scientists and pharmaceutical companies in the mass prodution of antibiotics. From penicillin to streptomycin and beyond.
